You say that as if you pop the shield, and then Yasuo politely waits out the shield's duration before engaging on you.

If you're a long-ranged mage, you can only pop the shield by using a high-damage spell that is blocked by the shield and leaves one of your important abilities on cooldown, or you get into auto attack range and give Yasuo an easy engage.

If you're melee, you let Yasuo engage on your for no effort and force a trade that can easily swing in Yasuo's favor because of the shield.

That the moment that you try to enter range to poke him, he just engages you E->Q3>E away.

Also Yasuo doesnt lose the entire shield, it just procs. He still has a shield for a couple of seconds, which is often enough to offset any damage his enemy can do before E'ing away.

Not to mention he can use windwall to just not lose the shield at all, and commit to longer trade which he will win any time.

Basically, Yasuo's game pattern and scaling rate give him every reason to play reactively until 1-2 items because he will outscale every single midlaner by then. This is why ''baiting'' the windwall doesnt work, because he doesnt need it to engage: because there is no reason for Yasuo to engage on laning phase when he can perfectly outscale anyone that isnt an adc by 2-3 items in.

His entire kit is made to be reactive and always come out on top unless the enemy midlaner can mostly ignore his windwall (IE Vlad) and power though.

No one is saying that he is strong, necessarely.

Just that his kit covers him too much for a champion that outscales almost all of the lane roster he faces, even when beyind.

While also being a pita to face on said lane.

i'm gonna try to honestly tell you why i hate wind wall so much. 

Wind wall is frustrating because.

1. The hitbox for blocking something is extremely generous and it comes out of yasuo. this means that if even a pixel of a giant spell (I.E nami wave) touches it the spell is removed. Not to mention aiming it is no harder then clicking in the general direction of the opponent. 

2. lack of counterplay options

"You can walk through it"
Useful if yasuo happens to be running from you but useless otherwise because your walking in melee range of a yasuo. 

"You can walk around it"
sometimes. Most of the time as an adc or mage you end up horribly mispositioned in a teamfight because wind wall is obnoxiously large. In lane walking around it leaves you extremely open to a jungle gank or close to yasuo anyways because he'll dash to you. 

"Just wait it out"
Yeah no. Wind wall has an extremely long duration of 4 seconds. Thats enough time for an entire teamfight to be decided, for your frontline to die because you can't do shit while their entire team is attacking them. 

"Bait it then go in"

3. Wind wall is genuinely an extremely easy and no skill spell to use besides the cooldown. 
"but yasuo takes a lot of skill"
yeah i agree but nothing about windwall involves any kind of skill besides not wasting it. Congrats you have to have the capabilities of having to deal with cooldown management like every other champion. 

4. Its just another get out of jail free card you have to deal with in his kit. 

Lets imagine we're ganking yasuo shall we. 

Your malphite pings he's coming in for a gank. Your playing Syndra/lux/orianna/fuckinganymage so as malphite is coming in you throw your cc and yasuo dashes out of the way. Malphite ults yasuo but you can't kill him because his shield absorbs too much burst. You throw one more spell to try and kill him and yasuo just wind walls. you could maybe have predicted the dash if you were fucking faker but he would have just dashed the other direction anyways. You could have walked into auto range except yasuo could easily kill you if you got up that far even though he'd probably die to malphite right afterwards. and you could do jack shit about the wind wall except hope yasuo's bad.

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=f0XHztQ5,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-10-24T07:52:45.729+0000)

Given how conditional his ult already is and its lower than average damage for a fighter type champion, making it unusable near towers would make it far too weak in 1v1 scenarios. 

Also, people are vastly exaggerating how this mechanic actually works. When Yasuo ults a target, he typically appears directly behind the champion "nothing personal, kid" style. However, if Yasuo ults a target just within a towers range, it will position him on a different side of his opponent so as to not eat a free turret shot while he's stuck in his ult animation. This only works when the enemy is just inside the towers range. A champion standing closer to their tower will suck Yasuo into it just like you'd expect because Yasuo must be very close to the enemy champion during his ult animation: approximately 300 units. It will not ever allow Yasuo to avoid tower shots while ulting someone directly under a tower. Given all the downsides Yasuo's ult already has, this extra functionality really isn't that unreasonable.
It doesn't have amazing damage itself, but it provides great cc and gives great penetration for his attacks after his ult.

In a 1v1, it CC's himself for the entire duration as well, making the effect of the CC a net zero. The bonus armor pen also only works against bonus armor, so against squishy champs, it basically does nothing. Compared to ults from other fighters like Riven's, Fiora's, Irelia's, etc., its a really mediocre dueling powerspike especially given how hard it can be to use. The only thing that makes it even remotely good in close duel situations is the shield refresh and that effect was added after his release precisely because his ult was far too weak in 1v1 situations otherwise.
A CC that buffs you, resets your passive shield, and lets you do damage while they are completely locked out is not in any way, shape, nor form wasted.  Get the *FUCK* out of here with that bullshit.
